result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mack Darrell Chambliss

records.addlTxt: Order for Presentence Investigation signed and filed.

At the hour of 4:34 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY as charged in the Information.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY as charged in the Information.  

AS TO COUNT 3:
"We, the jury, find the defendant, GUILTY as charged in the Information.  

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of *4:40PM jury dismissed for the day.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

* Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation. Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 12/9/22 at 10:30am, branch 25.

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Mack Darrell Chambliss.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Trial proceeded.  
Parties discuss additional matters with the court on the record. 
Defense rests. 
Jury in box. 
Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: Detective Timothy Keller (previously sworn in).  exhibit 21 received and published.
State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  
Jury out of box at 10:13am.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  
Jury in box at 11:49am.  
At the hour of 11:52 jury dismissed for lunch, but ordered to return at 1:20pm
BACK ON RECORD. Same appearances. Jury in box at 1:57pm.
Court instructed jury.  
Closing arguments by state and defense.  
Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:26 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Fabian and Saleem, who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
ON THE RECORD without jurors. Jurors' questions addressed.
Verdict reached at 4:32pm. Jury in box.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Mack Darrell Chambliss.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Trial proceeded. 
Jury in box at 9:35am.
Sworn for the state: Officer Shemar Moore; Witness: N. M. Court takes short recess. Jury out of box at 10:15am.  Jury back in box at 10:35am.
Sworn for the state:  Witness: S. S.; Forensic Pathologist, Dr. Jessica Lelinski; Deputy John Vande Burgt.; Deputy Frank Simpson.; Detective David Lopez. At the hour of 12:06pm jury dismissed for lunch and ordered to return at 1:20pm. Court address sidebars with parties on the record.
Case recalled. Jury in box. 
Sworn for the state: Inventory Controller, Sarah Westlund.; MPD Detective Alexander Kalbunde.; MPD Detective Martin Saavedra.; City of MKE Detective Jose Flores.; Detective Shaun Lesniewski. Court takes short recess. Jury out of box.  
Exhibits 1 through 20 received and published.
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify.
Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court. Parties  address additional matters with court on record. 
Jury in box at 3:33pm. 
State rests subject to rebuttal.  
Sworn for defense: Mack Chambliss.  
Defense rests.
At the hour of 4:55pm, jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return tomorrow at 9:00am

At the hour of 11:26 jury in box.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded.  
At the hour of 12:13 pm, jury dismissed for lunch, but ordered to return at 1:20 pm, branch 25.
CASE RECALLED AT 1:27pm.  Jury in box.
Voir dire proceeded. Jury selected. Court dismisses jurors for break and ordered to return at 3:05pm. Jury out of box at 2:42pm.
Jury in box at 3:11pm. 
Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  
Trial proceeded.  
Sworn for the state: City of MKE Detective, Timothy Keller.
Exhibits 1, 2, 3 received and published.
At the hour of 4:56 jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 9:15am, branch 25.

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Mack Darrell Chambliss.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty. Jury trial proceeded.

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Mack Darrell Chambliss.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense remains in trial posture.  Case passed.

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Mack Darrell Chambliss.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case remains in trial posture.  Defense has filed a request for prompt disposition on 7/12/2022 and expires 11/9/2022
received and filed.
received and filed.
received and filed.
received and filed.
Order to Produce, signed and filed.
Order to Produce, received.

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Discovery provided.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
FELON PRETRIAL SCHEDULING ORDER, signed and filed.
Per request of Defense, case is rescheduled for 8/4/22 at 8:30. No objection from the State. Parties notified.
Court's Decision and Order, signed, filed, and forwarded to parties.

Email correspondence with parties. Court re-scheduled Arraignment/Decision for 08/02/2022 at 10:00 am, Br 15.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.
Request for Prompt Disposition. Expires 11-6-2022.
Filed: Original Transcript of ADJOURNED HEARING ( 4 pages) commencing  3-16-22  by Amy De La Rosa.
Decision scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Arraignment scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 15:

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Telephone call received from Atty. Earle informing that the decision scheduled for today should be held before Hon. Judge J.D. Watts.
State present in court earlier today and advises that the arraignment cannot be conducted until decision by the Court.

Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail.
Co-defendant cases before Branch 15 on August 4.  Parties suggest this case be adjourned to the same date.

Case is adjourned for decision and arraignment in Branch 15.

State's Opposition to the Defense Motion to Dismiss, filed.

Filed: Original Transcript of HEARING (6 pages) commencing 04-22-2022, by LAURIE BURGHARDT.

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in custody. 
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom video means.  
Case in court for Arraignment. Filed, Original information. Discussions placed on the record. Arraignment adjourned for cause on motion of the State. Matter remains calendared before Branch 15 for Arraignment and Decision.  Decision scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.  Arraignment scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:06 AM Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court by video with Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle who appears in person.  Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 16CF178 in Waukesha County. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective T. Keller. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in custody.  
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for State vs Lee hearing. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Office of Public Defender has since appointed counsel for this matter. Matter set for preliminary hearing before Preliminary Hearing court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court with attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the public defenders office.  Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for State v. Lee hearing.  Attorney Reed placed reasoning for lack of counsel on this case on the record.  Court will adjourn hearing to allow PD's office time to find counsel.  Court requests attorney Reed to provide an update at next Court date.  Court takes defendant's motion to dismiss in abeyance.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Mack D. Chambliss - #2022001805, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Mack Darrell Chambliss in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mack Darrell Chambliss appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
